definitions: costing very little money; inexpensive compared to others of its type
of inferior quality or worth; shoddily made or produced without care
unwilling to spend money; showing meanness with resources or generosity
examples: We found cheap flights to Europe this summer
The cheap groceries helped them save money each month
That cheap furniture broke after only two months
Don't buy cheap tools that won't last long
He's too cheap to leave a proper tip
My cheap boss refuses to replace broken equipment

definitions: behaving dishonestly to gain unfair advantage, especially in games or examinations
being sexually or romantically unfaithful to one's partner or spouse
examples: The cheating student was caught using hidden notes
Cheating players ruin online gaming for everyone
She discovered her cheating husband's secret affair
His cheating behavior destroyed their ten-year marriage

definitions: marked with a pattern of squares, typically in two alternating colors
having been examined, verified, or marked as complete or accurate
kept under control or restraint; prevented from advancing or spreading
examples: She wore a blue and white checked shirt
The checked tablecloth gave the restaurant a homey feel
All checked items on the list are complete
The checked baggage was loaded onto the plane
His anger was carefully checked during the meeting
The army's advance was checked at the border

definitions: marked with a pattern of alternating squares of different colors
marked by periods of varied fortune or discreditable incidents; having both good and bad elements
examples: The race finished at the checkered flag
A checkered floor pattern decorated the grand hallway
His checkered past included both triumphs and scandals
The company has a checkered history of labor relations

definitions: showing a lack of respect or politeness in an amusing or annoying way
endearingly bold or spirited; showing playful impertinence or confidence
examples: The cheeky student talked back to the teacher
His cheeky remarks got him into trouble
She gave him a cheeky grin before running away
The cheeky toddler stuck out her tongue playfully

definitions: noticeably happy and showing positive emotions; in good spirits and optimistic
bright, pleasant, and creating a feeling of happiness through appearance or atmosphere
examples: The cheerful nurse brightened every patient's day
She remained cheerful despite the difficult circumstances
The cheerful yellow walls made the room inviting
A cheerful fire crackled in the fireplace

definitions: bringing feelings of happiness, comfort, or optimism to those experiencing it
providing moral support, encouragement, or renewed hope in difficult situations
examples: The cheering news lifted everyone's spirits immediately
A cheering cup of tea warmed her heart
His cheering words helped her through the crisis
The cheering crowd motivated the exhausted runners

definitions: showing or expressing happiness through bright, lively manner or appearance
maintaining a notably optimistic and positive attitude that uplifts others
examples: Her cheery greeting brightened the gloomy morning
The cheery decorations transformed the drab office space
Despite the setback, he maintained a cheery outlook
The cheery receptionist made visitors feel welcome immediately

definitions: tasting of cheese or having the flavor, smell, or texture of cheese
of poor quality; cheap-looking and lacking sophistication or good taste
embarrassingly sentimental or clich√©d; trying too hard to evoke emotion
examples: The cheesy sauce covered the nachos perfectly
These crackers have a delicious cheesy flavor
That cheesy motel sign flickered in neon colors
He wore a cheesy polyester suit from the seventies
The movie's cheesy dialogue made audiences cringe
She loves reading cheesy romance novels on vacation

definitions: of, relating to, or produced by chemistry or chemical processes and reactions
produced by or using artificial chemical substances rather than natural ones
examples: The chemical reaction produced unexpected results
Chemical analysis revealed traces of poison
Avoid using chemical fertilizers in organic gardens
The chemical smell from the factory was overwhelming

definitions: marked with a pattern of alternating colored squares like a checkerboard
marked by alternating periods of success and failure or good and bad
examples: The racing car crossed the chequered finish line
A black and white chequered pattern covered the floor
Her chequered career included brilliant successes and failures
The nation's chequered history shaped its modern identity

definitions: held dear and valued highly; treated with great affection and importance
carefully maintained and protected because of sentimental or personal value
examples: Her most cherished possession was her grandmother's ring
The cherished memories of childhood stayed with him
These cherished traditions have lasted for generations
The cherished photographs were kept in a special album

definitions: having the bright red color characteristic of ripe cherry fruit
made with, containing, or flavored with cherries or cherry extract
examples: She wore cherry red lipstick to the party
The cherry colored sports car gleamed in sunlight
The cherry pie won first prize at the fair
Cherry flavored medicine tastes better than most

definitions: having a deep reddish-brown color like that of chestnut wood or nuts
made from or containing chestnuts; having the flavor of chestnuts
examples: Her beautiful chestnut hair gleamed in the light
The horse's chestnut coat was perfectly groomed
The chestnut stuffing complemented the roasted turkey perfectly
Chestnut flour makes excellent gluten-free pasta

definitions: requiring considerable chewing before swallowing; tough or resistant to biting
having a firm, elastic texture that provides satisfying resistance when eaten
examples: The steak was too chewy to enjoy properly
Overcooked calamari becomes unpleasantly chewy
These chewy cookies have the perfect texture
The chewy candy lasted longer than hard varieties

definitions: elegantly and stylishly fashionable; showing sophisticated good taste in appearance
having a sophisticated, refined style that appears effortlessly fashionable and modern
examples: Her chic black dress impressed everyone at the gala
The chic boutique attracted fashionable shoppers
The restaurant's chic interior design won several awards
She has a naturally chic sense of personal style

definitions: showing fear or cowardice; unwilling to take risks or face danger
made from, containing, or relating to chicken meat as food
examples: Don't be chicken about jumping off the diving board
He's too chicken to ask her on a date
The chicken soup helped her recover from the cold
Chicken dishes are popular in most cuisines worldwide

definitions: most important or principal; having the greatest significance or influence
highest in rank or authority; holding the top position in hierarchy
examples: Safety was their chief concern during construction
The chief reason for delay was bad weather
The chief executive made the final decision
She served as chief engineer on the project

definitions: of an age or physical condition suitable for pregnancy and giving birth
relating to or involved in the process of pregnancy and giving birth
examples: Women of childbearing age need adequate folic acid
Her childbearing years were nearly over
The childbearing process affects the entire family
Childbearing complications can be serious without proper care

definitions: showing immature or silly behavior inappropriate for one's age; petty or trivial
of, like, or appropriate to a child; having qualities associated with childhood
examples: His childish tantrum embarrassed everyone at the meeting
Stop being so childish and discuss this maturely
The childish drawings decorated the kindergarten walls
Her childish enthusiasm for Christmas was endearing

definitions: not having any children, either by choice or circumstance; without offspring
examples: The childless couple devoted their time to travel
Many childless adults contribute significantly to their communities

definitions: having the good qualities associated with children such as innocence, trust, and wonder
resembling or showing qualities characteristic of a child in a positive way
examples: Her childlike wonder at the butterfly garden charmed everyone
He maintained a childlike faith in human goodness
The artist's childlike drawings had surprising emotional depth
Her childlike excitement about snow was infectious

definitions: causing fear or horror; deeply disturbing or frightening to experience or contemplate
causing a feeling of coldness; making one feel uncomfortably cold
examples: The chilling scream echoed through the empty house
Police discovered chilling evidence at the crime scene
The chilling wind cut through their winter coats
A chilling rain began to fall as darkness approached

definitions: unpleasantly cold but not freezing; cool enough to cause discomfort
showing unfriendliness or lack of warmth in manner or atmosphere
examples: The chilly morning air made her shiver slightly
It's getting chilly; you should wear a jacket
She received a chilly reception at the meeting
His chilly demeanor discouraged casual conversation

definitions: cheerful and lively in mood or manner; showing energetic good spirits
examples: Despite the early hour, she was remarkably chipper
The chipper salesman greeted every customer with enthusiasm

definitions: cut or shaped with a chisel; having been carved into a particular form
having strongly defined, angular features suggesting they were precisely carved or sculpted
examples: The chiseled stone bore ancient inscriptions
Chiseled letters marked each gravestone in the cemetery
His chiseled jawline made him perfect for modeling
The athlete's chiseled abs showed years of training

definitions: relating to the medieval system of chivalry and knightly behavior
displaying the gallant, courteous behavior associated with medieval knights
examples: The chivalric code governed medieval knights' behavior
Chivalric romances were popular in medieval literature
His chivalric gesture of offering his coat impressed her
Such chivalric behavior seems outdated to some people

definitions: showing special courtesy and respect particularly toward women; gallantly attentive
displaying the brave, honorable, and courteous qualities of an ideal knight
examples: His chivalrous behavior included opening doors for everyone
The chivalrous gentleman helped carry her heavy bags
The chivalrous knight defended the innocent villagers
His chivalrous nature compelled him to help strangers

definitions: of very good quality; superior or excellent in its category or class
carefully selected as being the best or most suitable from available options
examples: The butcher offered only choice cuts of meat
This restaurant serves choice wines from around the world
These choice words perfectly expressed her feelings
The museum displayed choice artifacts from the collection

definitions: blocked or clogged preventing normal flow or passage through something
unable to speak properly due to strong emotion such as tears or anger
examples: The choked drain caused water to back up
The choked streets made rush hour traffic terrible
Her choked voice revealed how moved she was
He gave a choked sob when hearing the news

definitions: causing difficulty in breathing by blocking the airway or reducing oxygen
creating overwhelming pressure or restriction that prevents normal function or performance
examples: The choking smoke forced everyone to evacuate
A choking smell of chemicals filled the laboratory
The choking pressure of deadlines affected his health
Her choking fear of failure paralyzed her progress

definitions: cut into small pieces with repeated sharp blows of a knife or tool
cut in a rough or irregular way; having an uneven chopped appearance
examples: Add chopped onions to the simmering sauce
The salad contained chopped vegetables and herbs
His chopped hair looked like he cut it himself
The chopped sentences made the writing feel abrupt

definitions: having rough, irregular waves or motion; not smooth or continuous
lacking smooth transitions; disconnected or abrupt in style or rhythm
examples: The choppy seas made everyone on board seasick
The boat struggled through the choppy waters
Her choppy writing style made the essay hard to follow
The choppy editing ruined the flow of the film

definitions: written for or relating to a choir or chorus of singers
performed by or consisting of a choir singing together in harmony
examples: The choral arrangement required eight different voice parts
She teaches choral music at the local college
The choral performance moved the audience to tears
Their choral voices filled the cathedral beautifully

definitions: relating to the art of creating and arranging dance movements and sequences
having qualities of planned, coordinated movement like choreographed dance
examples: Her choreographic genius revolutionized modern ballet
The choreographic notation preserved the original dance
The birds' choreographic mating display fascinated observers
Their choreographic precision impressed the Olympic judges

definitions: of, relating to, or professing Christianity or its teachings and beliefs
showing qualities associated with Christian teachings such as kindness, charity, and forgiveness
examples: The Christian church holds services every Sunday morning
Christian theology has influenced Western philosophy significantly
Her Christian charity helped many struggling families
He showed truly Christian forgiveness toward his enemies

definitions: relating to colors or the production of colors; having intense color
in music, using all twelve semitones of the octave; proceeding by half steps
examples: The chromatic spectrum displayed all visible colors
Her chromatic paintings exploded with vibrant hues
The chromatic scale includes every semitone
The composer used chromatic harmonies throughout the piece

definitions: of a disease or condition persisting for a long time or constantly recurring
having a particular bad habit or problem that persists over time
examples: She suffers from chronic back pain
Chronic diseases require ongoing medical management
He's a chronic liar who can't tell the truth
The team's chronic lateness frustrated their coach

definitions: arranged in the order in which events occurred or items appeared in time
following the natural sequence of time from earliest to latest
examples: The museum displayed artifacts in chronological order
Her chronological age didn't match her maturity level
The chronological narrative made the story easy to follow
Keep the files in strict chronological sequence

definitions: plump and rounded in a soft, appealing way, especially describing children or body parts
examples: The baby's chubby cheeks were irresistibly pinchable
His chubby fingers struggled with the tiny buttons

definitions: having a stocky, solid build; thick and substantial in appearance
containing chunks or lumps; having a texture with distinct pieces
examples: She wore chunky gold jewelry with her outfit
The chunky sweater kept her warm all winter
I prefer chunky peanut butter to smooth
The soup was thick and chunky with vegetables

definitions: moving violently with a swirling, agitated motion like churning butter
producing or generating something rapidly and continuously, often without regard to quality
examples: The churning waters made swimming dangerous
His churning stomach revealed his nervousness
The factory kept churning out cheap products
Publishers were churning bestsellers every month

definitions: relating to movies or the art and techniques of making movies
having qualities characteristic of cinema; visually dramatic or spectacular like a movie
examples: His cinematic techniques revolutionized action films
The festival celebrated cinematic achievements from around the world
The sunset created a cinematic moment perfect for photography
Her cinematic storytelling brought the novel to life

definitions: relating to biological processes that occur in twenty-four hour cycles, influenced by light and darkness
examples: Jet lag disrupts your circadian rhythm significantly
Circadian cycles affect hormone production and sleep patterns

definitions: longer than the most direct way; following a winding or indirect course to a destination
examples: They took a circuitous route to avoid traffic
His circuitous explanation confused everyone in the meeting

definitions: having the shape of a circle; round or ring-shaped in form
using reasoning that assumes what it attempts to prove; moving in cycles
examples: The circular table seated eight people comfortably
They arranged the chairs in a circular pattern
His circular argument didn't prove anything conclusive
The circular logic of the theory was its weakness

definitions: moving continuously through a closed system or circuit in regular pattern
being passed from person to person; being distributed or spread
examples: The circulating air kept the room temperature comfortable
Circulating blood carries oxygen throughout the body
The circulating rumors damaged his reputation significantly
Circulating library books reached thousands of readers

definitions: relating to the circulation of blood through the body via heart and blood vessels
examples: Regular exercise improves circulatory health significantly
Circulatory problems can cause numbness in extremities

definitions: restricted within defined limits; having freedom or scope limited by boundaries
drawn around another figure, touching it at points but not cutting it
examples: His circumscribed authority limited his decision-making power
Their circumscribed lives rarely extended beyond the village
The circumscribed circle touched all three triangle vertices
A circumscribed polygon surrounds the inner circle perfectly

definitions: based on circumstances that suggest something but don't prove it directly
containing full details or taking circumstances into account; not directly relevant
examples: The circumstantial evidence pointed to his guilt
Their case relied entirely on circumstantial proof
His circumstantial account included every minor detail
The report was thorough but largely circumstantial
